alert.note: Alert for Bering Strait Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island; Yukon Delta Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 4:36PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: A strong storm developing to the western Bering Sea today will move to the Northern Bering Sea tonight, then into the Central Chukchi Sea on Monday, and then north of Utqiagvik on Tuesday. This storm will bring south winds of 50 to 70 mph to the West Coast of Alaska on Monday. This could water levels along the coast to rise 3 to 5 feet from Shishmaref to Kivalina. This will likely cause water to flow on top of the sea ice and river ice near the coast, and could cause minor flooding of low lying areas near the coast such as around the lagoon at Kotzebue. Flooding of infrastructure is not expected but people should move valuables to higher ground. People should be alert for water pushing on top of snow machine trails that run over ice or along the coast.

area.areaDesc: Bering Strait Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island; Yukon Delta Coast
